intro: Omphalea diandra, commonly known as the golden apple or yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically tubular in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it has hairy, lobed leaves. Omphalea diandra is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
